RESOLUTION:

It looks like we were not setting `positionIdNextAfter` in `LimitEchidnaPool`.

Thus it was doing the comparison on the `positionIdNext` before and after the call.

Then `poolValues.positionIdNextAfter` was `0` and therefore our assertion of

>> poolValues.positionIdNextAfter == poolValues.positionIdNextBefore <<

was failing (i.e. 2 != 0).

Call sequence:
    *wait* Time delay: 1 seconds Block delay: 1
    mintRange(128844242950936924600225441726033579824,18446744073709551617,-40,200)
    mintThenPartialBurnTwiceLiquidityChange(4053546069,true,-90,-20,151365577398536353558815557146450947617)

Event sequence:
